intro: Pinacopodium congolense, commonly known as the Congo sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny, spherical fruiting bodies. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Its flowers are small and clustered, with both male and female flowers occurring on the same plant. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
